original: dumā nekaphalā bahū;🔽Kasmā nu sukkhe koḷāpe,
analyzed: dumāḥ neka phalāḥ  kasmā nu sukkhe koḷāpe

translated: Why is your mind set on a dry, leafless tree?”

analyzed: sā ava mā itti yathā pure
translated: I still love it as before.”
what fault do you see, bird?”
“Those who gather for the sake of fruit,
leave it when it is fruitless;
They are foolish, knowing only their own good,
“Good is the friendship that is made,
If you approve of this teaching,
you are praiseworthy among the wise.
I will give you a boon, Suva,
a tree with seven leaves and fruit;
Like a poor man who has found a treasure,
I would rejoice again and again.”
Just as I am happy today,
Having given the boon to Suvassa,
and having made the tree fruitful,
to the Nandana Grove of the gods.”
The Short Story of Suvassa, the Fourth.
